intro: Psychotria venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Venezuela and neighboring countries. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
